attributes.action: Keep gyms open during this COVID rise for a severe push in mental health.
attributes.additional_details: To control and possibly reduce depression rates that are/will be caused from another lockdown. The gyms and leisure activities are an output for people, to keep their mind and body healthy.
attributes.background: All Gyms and local leisure centre to remain open for people’s physical but more importantly mental health. There is a limited number of COVID cases that are brought from gyms so they should be allowed to remain open. It is essential to keep people mentally healthy during another second lockdown

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
